abstract: Congressional Republicans continue to hold ranks against approval of Iran nuclear accord, with some House Republicans saying they may file lawsuit charging Obama administration with failure to meet its legal obligations to disclose full details of accord; Senate Democratic leaders express exasperation over prospect of prolonged partisan battle through 2016 presidential and congressional elections.
lead_paragraph: The House rejected the deal overwhelmingly, along partisan lines, as congressional Republicans showed no sign of letting up in their effort to pressure the White House.

headline.print_headline: Partisan Vote in House Rejects Pact With Iran

snippet: The House rejected the deal overwhelmingly, along partisan lines, as congressional Republicans showed no sign of letting up in their effort to pressure the White House.
